Hollywood star Alec Baldwin is the latest celebrity to speak out about Louis Tomlinson's airport bust-up. 
The actor advised Louis to pay for a bodyguard while he doesn't have the responsibilities of a wife or kids, after his scuffle with two female fans and a photographer at LAX airport on Saturday. 
The One Direction singer was released on a £16,000 bail and has hired tough Hollywood lawyer Marty 'Mad Dog' Singer to fight his police charges , whose high-profile past clients include Sharon Stone and John Travolta. 
Speaking on Good Morning Britain, the eldest Baldwin brother, who was plugging animated movie The Boss Baby, said: "It’s never a good idea to respond. Read More Shocking video shows Louis Tomlinson and girlfriend in airport altercation with fans that led to his arrest Alec Baldwin had some words of wisdom for Louis (Photo: ITV) 
“But if you do, I say to people, they got the better of you, and try to do better. 
"When you are young and you don’t have a wife or especially children take my advice, use that money now for a bodyguard." 
Host Piers Morgan also came to the defence of popstar Louis, who jumped in to protect girlfriend model Eleanor Calder from an altercation with two girls. Read More According to Alec the One Direction star needs a bodyguard to protect him (Photo: ITV) 
"You have to remember, Louis lost his mum recently, he's been through a grieving process," he said. 
"And then you've got these two crazy fans who now seem to be boasting that they've caused this scene. 
"What sort of fans are you?" 
A-lister Alec is the latest celebrity to have his say on the airport brawl, after former Spice Girl Mel C defended Louis admitting she had been in a similar 'frenzied situation'. Louis has hired the 'Mad Dog' to fight his case (Photo: Splash) 
Speaking to Piers and Susanna Reid on yesterday's Good Morning Britain, Melanie said: “It can be quite traumatic, that sounds a little overdramatic. 
“There are times, I should imagine with Louis and what the boys have been through, that they have been at the height of their success and they are constantly pursued. 
"And I think you come into an environment like that and it's quite frenzied and it's quite chaotic and you have a fight-or-flight response sometimes." 
Under California law, Louis could face six months in jail and fines of £1,600 if convicted of assault and battery, as well as facing visa issues which would stop him entering the US. 
Louis' lawyer Marty Singer has said: "The paparazzi provoked and caused the altercation that occurred with Louis at the airport this morning. 
"This is not the first or last time that a paparazzo has created an altercation with a celebrity. 
"While the altercation was going on with the paparazzi, three other individuals were attacking his girlfriend during this incident and he came to her defence." Like us on Facebook
